column1: Which choice explains how the evaporation of sweat “cools” our body?
column2: Evaporating water molecules carry with them more than the average amount of kinetic energy which leaves the remaining molecules with a lower aver-age kinetic energy.
column3: The body loses more heat through the infrared radiation emitted by sweat than it gains from the infrared radiation emitted by the surroundings.
column4: Sweat is at a lower temperature than our core body temperature so sweat on our skin cools us by conduction.
column5: The water molecules in sweat are at a higher temperature than our core body temperature so losing sweat leaves us cooler due to the mass of water lost.
